image.altText: A smiling man wearing a cap.

props.synopsis: The mother of a 28-year-old man who went missing in regional Queensland in June 2023 has learnt from media reports that her son has died.

title.children: 'Left in the dark': Grieving mum finds out via media that remains belong to her missing son

image.altText: Clare O'Neil speaks during Question Time

props.synopsis: The federal government is promising greater public transparency over its handling of almost 150 people recently released from detention, as it fears further legal challenges will dramatically reshape parts of the nation's immigration system.

title.children: Government pledges transparency as it braces for reshaping of immigration system

image.altText: A cyclone track map covering the eastern NT.

props.synopsis: The BOM issues a cyclone watch for coastal communities in the Gulf of Carpentaria from Groote Eylandt down to the NT-Queensland border, as it forecasts a tropical low to strengthen into a cyclone in the Gulf tomorrow.

title.children: Cyclone expected to form over Gulf of Carpentaria on Saturday, as BOM issues watch alert

image.altText: Child's hand on play equipment

props.synopsis: A Queensland woman says she has become "strong, resilient and powerful" and is proud of herself for fighting against the man who sexually abused her, as he is jailed for 10 years.

title.children: Young woman tells uncle he 'took away her innocence' after sexually abusing her regularly from the age of five

image.altText: A graphic showing a positive COVID-19 RAT, a representation of the virus and a woman blowing her nose.

props.synopsis: The state's chief health officer says the description wrongly implied long-term post-COVID viral symptoms were "somehow unique and exceptional" to other viral infections.

title.children: Queensland's Chief Health Officer says it's time to stop using the term 'long COVID'

image.altText: A woman sitting at a park

props.synopsis: Laura Murphy says women deserve more information about the potential risks involved in a common surgical procedure.

title.children: Laura wasn't told her operation could cause infertility. She says doctors are leaving women in the dark

image.altText: A Sydney Swans forward pumps his fist as he runs away after a goal.

props.synopsis: The Sydney Swans spoil the premiership flag party for Collingwood at the MCG with a solid win — but the defending premiers are left with issues after starting the season 0-2. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: Swans too strong for Magpies at the MCG, as questions mount for defending premiers

image.altText: Clint Gutherson talks to the referee

props.synopsis: Defending premiers Penrith earned their first win of the 2024 NRL season against Parramatta, after Cronulla fought hard to beat Canterbury-Bankstown at Shark Park.

title.children: Eels 'dudded' by calls in Panthers defeat as Luai placed on report twice, Bulldogs coach frustrated with referee after Sharks defeat

image.altText: A middle-aged woman in a red outfit looks serious as she sits at a table in court.

props.synopsis: A Georgia judge says he did not conclude that Fani Willis's relationship with a special prosecutor amounted to a conflict of interest, however he said it created an "appearance of impropriety".

title.children: Judge says Fulton County DA can stay on Trump case if she removes top prosecutor

image.altText: Fire fighters work to extinguish a fire in a bombed out building surrounded by rubble

props.synopsis: Scores of people have been killed across Ukraine and Russia as both sides continues aerial attacks using missiles and drones.

title.children: Russian missile strikes kill at least 14 people in Odesa as Ukraine conflict rages

image.altText: A hole shows where the panel was very close to where passengers sat

props.synopsis: More passengers who were on the Alaska Airlines jet when part of its fuselage blew out are suing.

title.children: Man almost sucked out of Boeing 737 was saved by seatbelt, says lawsuit

image.altText: A curved sandstone wall with the words 'Cranbrook School  Murray Rose Aquatic & Fitness Centre'.

props.synopsis: A teacher sent sexually explicit texts to a former student five years after he was kept on by the headmaster of Sydney's prestigious Cranbrook School after admitting to another former pupil he had looked up girls' skirts.

title.children: 'I just feel sick': Former student sent sexually explicit texts by Cranbrook teacher

image.altText: A person in shadow walks through a caged internal courtyard covered in more shadows.

props.synopsis: A report into child deaths across Queensland has revealed the shocking amount of time two young boys spent in solitary confinement in youth detention centres before their "preventable" deaths.

title.children: Boy who died after being released from youth detention was 'spat on, punched and bullied' inside, report finds

image.altText: A torn up demountable.

props.synopsis: Queensland Health's maternity patient records were left lying around in an unlocked dilapidated demountable office — dumped on public land on Thursday Island — the ABC has confirmed.

title.children: 'Incredibly serious' allegations referred to Crime and Corruption Commission as patient files found in dilapidated demountable

image.altText: Minister for Foreign Affairs Penny Wong speaks to journalists in canberra on monday october 16, 2023

props.synopsis: Australia will resume funding to the United Nations aid agency for Palestinians, UNRWA, Foreign Minister Penny Wong has announced.

title.children: Australia to resume funding to UN Palestinian aid agency UNRWA

image.altText: nicotine pouches in tin

props.synopsis: School leaders are calling for proactive action to prevent students from purchasing nicotine pouches, with researchers warning the potency of products varies wildly and health risks remain unknown.

title.children: Teachers warn school kids may swap vapes for 'impossible-to detect' nicotine pouches

image.altText: Peter Dutton sits in the House of Representatives

props.synopsis: The CSIRO has rebuked politicians seeking to undermine its research showing nuclear energy would be much more expensive than solar or wind power, after Liberal leader Peter Dutton claimed that research had been "discredited".

title.children: CSIRO boss hits back at Dutton over nuclear power research

image.altText: By-election candidate signs of Trang Yen and Margie Nightingale.

props.synopsis: By-elections in two Labor heartland seats being held alongside tomorrow's local government elections are shaping up as the ultimate curtain-raiser for the Queensland state election in October.

title.children: 'Expect a correction': By-elections to set the stage for a fierce Queensland election battle

image.altText: A woman wearing a pink jacket standing in front of a set of tables and trees.

props.synopsis: Labor says it will axe projects like the Victoria Park redevelopment and the council's green bridges program to pay for its promises, but it does not have a "set figure" on how much its proposed FOGO scheme would cost.

title.children: Labor releases election costings ahead of Brisbane council election with $400 million in commitments

image.altText: A woman kitesurfs on a lake.

props.synopsis: One of south-east Queensland's largest lakes is a stingray breeding area, but not everyone knows to tread lightly there. A pair of kitesurfers still dealing with the fallout from being stung say it's time to take action.

title.children: Stingray barbs cause pain '100 times worse than childbirth'. Is enough being done to keep people safe?

image.altText: A hand holding a Palestinian passport.

props.synopsis: The federal government suggests Palestinians escaping the war in Gaza “without explanation” of how they fled is a factor in their Australian visas being cancelled.

title.children: Government cites lack of explanation about how Palestinians fled war-torn Gaza for visa cancellations

image.altText: NSW shadow attorney-general Alister Henskens in speaks in state parliament.

props.synopsis: Senior planning department official Katie Joyner is accused of allegedly purchasing a property in the upper north shore suburb of Gordon within one of the government's planned Transport Oriented Development zones, before the policy was made public.

title.children: Planning bureaucrat at centre of corruption scandal named under parliamentary privilege

image.altText: Toyota Hilux

props.synopsis: The Coalition says Labor's proposed fuel efficiency standards constitute a tax on utes and family cars. What do the experts say?

title.children: We fact checked Peter Dutton on whether Labor's new fuel efficiency standards are a 'ute tax'. Here's what we found

image.altText: A close-up of Alec Baldwin.

props.synopsis: Actor Alec Baldwin's lawyers ask a judge to dismiss manslaughter charges against him for the fatal shooting of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins during filming, alleging prosecutorial misconduct.

title.children: Alec Baldwin asks judge to dismiss charges in Rust movie shooting

image.altText: Two men wearing industrial ear muffs, black protective glasses and caps in a small room with electrical equipment.

props.synopsis: Bitcoin mining was about to end both Andy and Russ's marriages until they met each other and set up a "farm". But now they face more hurdles, as a pre-coded dystopian event looms and crypto-cynics predict a crash.

title.children: Russ and Andy had 'Frankenstein's monster' in their living rooms, so they joined forces to set up a Bitcoin farm

image.altText: A generic photo of ASX board.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has ended lower on Friday, but recovered slightly after falling sharply as investors worried hotter-than-expected inflation in the US could delay global interest rate cuts. Look back on the day's financial news as it happened with our blog.

title.children: ASX ends lower despite late recovery from US interest rate worries, Optus services 'progressively restored' after customer call issues — as it happened

image.altText: Head shot of a person with a beard and long brunette hair who appears warm and smiling.

props.synopsis: The popular feel-good Netflix show Queer Eye has been rocked by accusations of a toxic workplace behind the scenes, with the most popular cast member facing the worst of the allegations. Why does the story of the kind celebrity falling from grace sound so familiar?

title.children: 'How do I process this information?': What happens when a beloved celebrity falls from grace

image.altText: A composite of Meghan, Duchess of Sussex and the words American Riviera Orchard.

props.synopsis: The Duchess of Sussex launches her new brand, hinting at a potential pivot to lifestyle content, in her first post in nearly four years. Here's what we know so far.

title.children: Meghan Markle returns to social media with new brand amid Princess Kate speculation

image.altText: A rice field in Bali

props.synopsis: Two foreign tourists including an Australian woman have been killed on the Indonesian resort island of Bali after heavy rain triggered a landslide that swept away their villa, an official said on Thursday.

title.children: Australian woman killed in Bali landslide

image.altText: Andrew Giles during QT

props.synopsis: Muslim community organisations are unhappy after grants announced for Muslim and Jewish communities to improve social cohesion were given to two news organisations and the Human Rights Commission instead of Islamic and Arab groups.

title.children: Muslim and Arab leaders incensed over distribution of social cohesion grants five months into war

image.altText: A man in a blue suit holds an envelope in his left hand.

props.synopsis: It's time to test your knowledge about the news of the week.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: From Oscars to who 'killed' Princess Catherine's photo, were you paying attention this week?

image.altText: Spectators gather to watch the spacecraft launch in Texas. They all point at the sky

props.synopsis: SpaceX's Starship rocket, designed to eventually send astronauts to the Moon, completed nearly an entire test flight after two previous failures.

title.children: SpaceX Starship disintegrates after completing most of test flight

image.altText: Scott Morrison in a grandstand swinging a Sharks jersey around his head, holding a beer.

props.synopsis: The former PM is a longtime public supporter of the Sharks, concluding his final speech in parliament last month with the team's motto: "And, as always — up, up Cronulla."

title.children: Scott Morrison to hand back 'number 1 ticketholder' title at Cronulla Sharks

image.altText: Hitchhiking in Canada

props.synopsis: Alice Garner hitchhiked long distances with her dad when she was young, but she says she wouldn't let her daughter do it today. Why did it become viewed as a dangerous pursuit rather than an adventurous one?

title.children: Hitchhikers were once a common sight on the side of Australian roads. So what's changed?

image.altText: Head Coach Benji Marshall of the Wests Tigers looks on following the NRL Pre-season challenge match between New Zealand Warriors and Wests Tigers at Apollo Projects Stadium on February 18, 2024 in Christchurch, New Zealand.

props.synopsis: As a player, Benji Marshall was never afraid to take a chance. After selecting 18-year-old Lachlan Galvin to debut at five-eighth in Wests Tigers season opener, he's showing the same quality as a coach.

title.children: 'There's no fear in what he does': Why Benji Marshall has taken a chance on the Tigers' latest teen sensation
